lines.text: [Launching the Jupiter-1]
And the monkey flips the switch.
Never fear, Smith is here.
[Why the others should believe his warning about the spiders]
Trust me, Major. Evil knows evil.
Never love anything, kiddo, you will just end up losing it.
It sounds like old morse code.
What does it say?
Danger, Will Robinson, danger.

[to her diary]
On this eve before she is torn from all she knows, kidnapped, hurled into deep space against her will, what thoughts fill the mind of the young space captive?
Will there be boys on Alpha Prime? Whatever will I wear?
You'll forgive me if I forgo the kiss, my sleeping behemoth. But the time has come to awake.
Robot is on-line. Reviewing primary directives. One, preserve the Robinson Family. Two, Maintain ship systems. Three
What noble charges my steely centurion. Sadly I fear you have far more dire deeds in store for you.
Robot is on-line. Reviewing primary directives. Two hours into mission destroy Robinson family. Destroy all systems.
Now that's more like it. Farewell my platinum-plated-pal. Give my regards to oblivion.
Let's see, do I spend my last night on Earth watching Mom and Dad pretend not to be fighting, or blow ten years worth of allowance at the mall? You do the math.
[the Robinson family shares a tender moment of love as they are reunited]
You know, the planet IS breaking up around us.

[after seeing the old ship 20 years into the future]
Oh shit!
A boy of your intelligence should never swear.
[Smith sees the old ship]
Oh shit. Indeed.
Who was it that said, "Those who can't think, fight"? I think it was me.
[walks away]

[to Prof. Robinson]
That's one cold fish I'd like to thaw.
[Judy returns]
[to Prof. Robinson]
Oh, I won't be home for dinner tonight, *Dad*.
[Judy walks away. West stares at John, who also walks away]
It's gonna be a *long* flight.
You know, I'm thinking this is your "kiss for luck" situation.
Thinking. Not your strong point, is it?

8 years of flight training. Navigational holographics online. 50 combat missions. Course confirmed for slingshot exit of the solar system. Just so I could take the family camper on an interstellar picnic.
[to her diary, about Major West]
Ouch. Could he be cuter? I don't *think* so.
Will Robinson! I will tell you a joke! Why did the robot cross the road? Because he was carbon bonded to the chicken!
We've got a *lot* of work to do.
Black was always my colour.
OK, last one to kill a bad guy buys the beer.
Like the drip, drip, drip of blood...
You really need to shut up.
There's a lot of space out there to get lost in.
Give my regards to oblivion.
What about you, Doc? Is there some lucky little nerd you left behind?
I've spent the last three years training for this mission. I'm trying to save the planet. I haven't had time for fun.
If there's no time for fun, Doc, then what are we saving the planet for?
[as Will looks for parts to Robot's body]
Relax, Robot. I'm going to build you a new body. Mom always said I should make new friends.
Oh, ha ha.

[reprogramming the future Robot]
Let's try this again, shall we? You are the puppet, I am the puppeteer. Do try to get it right this time...
[Major West arms the Proteus' reactor to explode, to kill the Space Spiders]
What are you doing?
You never leave an enemy stronghold intact.
Major, stop.
One of your father's first rules of engagement.
That's a direct order.
I hate spiders.
[the Jupiter II is hurtling towards the Sun]
We're caught in the sun's gravitational pull. We're headed straight for it.
Oh, really? Is that what the big round ball is?
It's working.
What?
If we can't go around the Sun, then we go straight through it, using your hyperdrive.
If we engage the hyperdrive without a gate, we could be thrown anywhere in the galaxy.
Anywhere but here.
I'm going to try to break us out of the atmosphere.
No, we don't have enough core material for that.
Well, maybe if we catch one of the thermal...
No, it won't work. I *know*. We have to go... down. Through the planet as she's breaking up. We can use the planet's gravity...
What?
To throw us ut the other side and back into space!
That's insane!
I don't have time to argue.

Am I interrupting something? No really, I think you two should go ahead and slug it out. I mean, here we are on an alien world and you boys want to get into a pissing contest? Please, go for it. I'll have Judy down here in a heartbeat to declare you both unfit, and I'll take over this mission. Now I don't want to hear another word from either of you, is THAT clear?

[speaking through Robot]
Mom says to get the hell outta there!
Get the hell out of there!

[speaking through the Robot]
Mom says to get the hell out of there.
Professor Robinson, how do your children feel about traveling into space for the next ten years?
They couldn't be more excited.
[next scene]
This mission sucks!
Get the hell out of there!

[being controlled by Will]
Mom says, get the hell out of there!

[West assembles his gun as the spiders are attacking]
A million bucks worth of weaponry, and I'd trade it all back for a lousy can of Raid.
I'm a doctor, not a space explorer.
Destroy Robinson family.
Here we go again.
This mission sucks. I don't wanna leave early. I don't wanna go at all.
We will discuss this at dinner.
For the last three years, I've missed everything. Training. So I can spend the next ten years missing everything else. I'm not staying home for dinner. I'm going out to see my friends.
Penny.
I'm going out to... say good-bye to my entire life.
Penny I need you here tonight.
We're lost, aren't we?
Have you noticed, you take to opposite position to whatever I say?
Of course I do, we're married.
NOT another word. Better. Now if you've finished hosing down the decks with testosterone, I suggest you come with me. I may have found a way to get us off this planet.
Sarcasm is the recourse of the weak mind.
If this is all a dream, why can't there be more girls?
I loathe children.
You should have killed me when you had the chance.
You know, you're right. I couldn't kill the man...
[takes out on of Will's science fair plaques as an improvised weapon]
But I can kill the monster!
Haven't you made the doorway... too small?
Not for me. But then, I'm not going, am I? The spiders didn't kill the girls. It was you. I just didn't let myself see it. You kept me alive because you needed me. Because I could build this for you.
Poor, poor boy. Did you think that I would let you go? After all that I have become? Look at me. I am no mere man.
[He takes off the clothes covering him to reveal a spider/human figure]
I am a god. Within these eggsacks lives a monster race of spiders. We shall descend upon helpless Earth. An entire planet on which to rule. An entire planet on which to feed! Time to die, *son*.
I'm not your son!

[to the Robot]
Unhand me, you mechanical moron.
Oh, shit.
A boy of your intelligence should never swear... Oh, shit.
[Will, through the robot's holographic interface, sees the spiders eating the other injured spiders]
Eww. They eat their wounded.

[after will alters holographic projection of his principal, making her look like a gorilla]
No more monkey business!
[after attacking Dr. Smith]
I never liked me anyway.
You can't do it can you? You can't kill the man without becoming the monster.
Oh, be still my foolish heart.
It's the world behind the world Dr. Robinson. Lie once, cheat twice, and everything becomes clear.

[just before the spaceship explodes]
I'm sorry.
Major West, I highly recommend you never breed. That, by the way, is my medical opinion.

[to Will Robinson]
Let me tell you a lesson about life, kid. There are monsters everywhere... I know, I am one.
Something you should abide by on this world or any other, never trust anyone. Especially me.
[First night on an unknown unfriendly looking planet they crashed on]
Good night, John.
Good night, Maureen.
Good night, Judy.
Good night, Will.
Good night, Penny.
[pause]
You guys have got to be kidding.

[to Penny]
Do they have a name for what's wrong with you?
Can we cut back on her air supply so she's not so annoying when she wakes up?
Does he have to wake up at all?
Nothing good can come of this.
[last lines]

[before the Jupiter goes into hyperdrive]
Initiate now.
Cool!
